value: be prepared that if there is an accident you can't go anywhere but sit in traffic until the road is re-opened.

stopping at Clute, Fraserdale, Coral Rapids, Moose River, and any point on the line to pick up/drop off hikers, campers, canoeists, fishermen, outdoor adventurers, and locals. This is one of the few "flag stop" trains in operation in Canada. Operates five days a week year round. During the summer months, there is an additional train on Sundays. No train service on Saturdays or on Sundays during the rest of the year. There is a special canoe car that can hold up to 18 canoes. Canoeists are responsible for unloading and loading their own canoes. No reservations are required. Cost an additional $54 plus GST to train fare. Snack car service and a special family car are available year round. Summer trains also feature: full dining car service, a dome car, and an entertainment car with live music. In summer 2008, track conditions resulted the train running very late much of the time (2.5 hours by railway announcement).
Union Station has been cancelled and replaced by a bus which stops at Matheson (with connecting bus to Iroquois Falls and
), Swastika (with connecting bus to Kirkland Lake), Englehart, New Liskeard, Cobalt, Temagami,
, South River, Huntsville, Bracebridge, Gravenhurst, and Washago.

Ontario Northland bus service runs daily local service westbound to Hearst with connection in Driftwood to
, and Orillia; southbound to Toronto via Temiskaming Shores, North Bay, and
for the Northlander and to Iroquois Falls and Timmins for the Polar Bear Express. Bus service also operates from the train station (see above).
